title: Install podmanâ€‹
content: ğŸ‘‰ How to run Podman on Windows with WSL2

title: Install podman-composeâ€‹
content: Install python3 and pip: sudo apt-get -y install python3 python3-venv python3-pip pip3 install podman-compose Copy Notice that you have to add ~/.local/bin to PATH

title: Integrate podman-compose and fishâ€‹
content: Install the latest fish shell for fish_add_path if your fish is < 3.3.0: # Check version $ fish -v fish, version 3.3.1 $ sudo apt-add-repository ppa:fish-shell/release-3 $ sudo apt-get update $ sudo apt-get install fish Copy Check the official document if you use another distribution. Add into ~/.config/fish/config.fish: fish_add_path ~/.local/bin Copy

title: Referenceâ€‹
content: Windows Subsystem for Linux Installation Guide for Windows 10How to run Podman on Windows with WSL2

title: Compress Without Root Folderâ€‹
content: This will compress with root folder: # Compress ./relative/dir/myFile 7z a -r my7z.7z relative/dir/* # Uncompress to ./relative/dir/myFile 7z x my7z.7z Copy This will compress without root folder: # Compress ./relative/dir/myFile 7z a -r my7z.7z ./relative/dir/* # Uncompress to ./my7z/myFile 7z x -omy7z my7z.7z Copy Reference: https://stackoverflow.com/questions/10753667/compressing-only-files-using-7z-without-preserving-the-path

title: Examplesâ€‹
content: # archive only to .zip 7z a -tzip -mx=0 myzip.zip # level-9 compress to .zip 7z a -tzip -mx=9 myzip.zip Copy Reference: https://sevenzip.osdn.jp/chm/cmdline/switches/method.htm

title: Formatâ€‹
content: $ date '+%Y-%m-%d %H:%M:%S.%N' 2019-12-04 14:27:59.372201900 Copy Some OS like alpine does not support milliseconds Reference: https://stackoverflow.com/questions/1401482/yyyy-mm-dd-format-date-in-shell-script/47216077

title: Timezoneâ€‹
content: $ TZ=Asia/Taipei date '+%Y-%m-%d %H:%M:%S' 2019-12-04 14:27:59 Copy Reference: https://unix.stackexchange.com/questions/48101/how-can-i-have-date-output-the-time-from-a-different-timezoneTimezone List: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_tz_database_time_zones (check TZ database name column) If TZ not works, install tzdata

title: Nginx Quick Test With Dockerâ€‹
content: Any unix shells: docker run -it --rm -v $PWD:/usr/share/nginx/html:ro -p 5000:80 nginx Copy bash: docker run -it --rm -v $(pwd):/usr/share/nginx/html:ro -p 5000:80 nginx docker run -it --rm -v $(pwd)/build:/usr/share/nginx/html/subfolder:ro -p 5000:80 nginx Copy fish: docker run -it --rm -v (pwd):/usr/share/nginx/html:ro -p 5000:80 nginx docker run -it --rm -v (pwd)/build:/usr/share/nginx/html/subfolder:ro -p 5000:80 nginx Copy cmd: docker run -it --rm -v %CD%:/usr/share/nginx/html:ro -p 5000:80 nginx docker run -it --rm -v %CD%/build:/usr/share/nginx/html/sub-folder:ro -p 5000:80 nginx Copy powershell: docker run -it --rm -v "$pwd\:/usr/share/nginx/html\:ro" -p 5000:80 nginx docker run -it --rm -v "$pwd/build\:/usr/share/nginx/html/sub-folder\:ro" -p 5000:80 nginx Copy

title: Push Local Files to Remoteâ€‹
content: Push files under a directory to a directory: # local remote # /a/b/c/1 /x/ # /a/b/c/2 # /a/b/c/3 rsync -av -e ssh /a/b/c/ root@172.17.0.2:/x/ # local remote # /a/b/c/1 /x/1 # /a/b/c/2 /x/2 # /a/b/c/3 /x/3 Copy Push a folder to a directory: # local remote # /a/b/c/1 /x/ # /a/b/c/2 # /a/b/c/3 rsync -av -e ssh /a/b/c root@172.17.0.2:/x/ # local remote # /a/b/c/1 /x/c/1 # /a/b/c/2 /x/c/2 # /a/b/c/3 /x/c/3 Copy Push a file to a directory: # local remote # /a/b/c/1 /x/ rsync -av -e ssh /a/b/c/1 root@172.17.0.2:/x/2/ # local remote # /a/b/c/1 /x/2/1 Copy Push a file to a path: # local remote # /a/b/c/1 /x/ rsync -av -e ssh /a/b/c/1 root@172.17.0.2:/x/2 # local remote # /a/b/c/1 /x/2 Copy

title: mkdir -pâ€‹
content: rsync doesn't create directory tree. Use --rsync-path --rsync-path=PROGRAM Use this to specify what program is to be run on the remote machine to start-up rsync. # local remote # /a/b/c/1 /x/ # /a/b/c/2 # /a/b/c/3 $ rsync -av -e ssh /a/b/c/ root@172.17.0.2:/x/y/z/ sending incremental file list rsync: mkdir "/x/y/z" failed: No such file or directory (2) rsync error: error in file IO (code 11) at main.c(675) [Receiver=3.1.2] $ rsync -av -e ssh --rsync-path="mkdir -p /x/y/z && rsync" /a/b/c/ root@172.17.0.2:/x/y/z/ # local remote # /a/b/c/1 /x/y/z/1 # /a/b/c/2 /x/y/z/2 # /a/b/c/3 /x/y/z/3 Copy Notice that mkdir -p and rsync should works on remote. Reference: https://askubuntu.com/questions/561212/rsync-throwing-mkdir-cannot-create-directory-data-dir-1-dir-2-dir-3-no-suc

title: Deleteâ€‹
content: # local remote # /a/b/c/1 /x/y/z/1 # /a/b/c/2 /x/y/z/3 # /a/b/c/3 $ rsync -av -e ssh /a/b/c/ root@172.17.0.2:/x/y/z/ # local remote # /a/b/c/1 /x/y/z/1 # /a/b/c/2 /x/y/z/3 # /a/b/c/3 rsync -av -e ssh --delete /a/b/c/ root@172.17.0.2:/x/y/z/ # local remote # /a/b/c/1 /x/y/z/1 # /a/b/c/3 /x/y/z/3 Copy

title: Excludeâ€‹
content: # local remote # /a/b/c/1 /x/ # /a/b/c/2 # /a/b/c/3 rsync -av -e ssh /a/b/c/ root@172.17.0.2:/x/ --exclude 2 # local remote # /a/b/c/1 /x/1 # /a/b/c/2 /x/3 # /a/b/c/3 Copy Multiple: # local remote # /a/b/c/1 /x/ # /a/b/c/2 # /a/b/c/3 rsync -av -e ssh /a/b/c/ root@172.17.0.2:/x/ --exclude 2 --exclude 3 # local remote # /a/b/c/1 /x/1 # /a/b/c/2 # /a/b/c/3 Copy Wildcard: # local remote # /a/b/c/1 /x/ # /a/b/c/2 # /a/b/c/3 # /a/b/c/4.md # /a/b/c/5.md # /a/b/c/6.md rsync -av -e ssh /a/b/c/ root@172.17.0.2:/x/ --exclude "*.md" # local remote # /a/b/c/1 /x/1 # /a/b/c/2 # /a/b/c/3 Copy

title: Replacement Character ï¿½â€‹
content: U+FFFD ï¿½ REPLACEMENT CHARACTER used to replace an unknown, unrecognized or unrepresentable character. Reproduction node@12.2.0 :  // node new Buffer.from( new Buffer.from([...new Buffer.from('ğŸ˜„')].slice(1)).toString() ); // <Buffer ef bf bd ef bf bd ef bf bd> Copy Specials (Unicode block) | Wikipedia

title: last-updated with Local Timeâ€‹
content: Tested modules: vuepress@1.0.0-alpha.47date-fns@2.0.0-alpha.27 Pass timestamp instead of formatted time string in .vuepress/config.js:  module.exports = { plugins: { '@vuepress/last-updated': { + transformer: timestamp => timestamp || new Date(), }, }, }; Copy Modify your theme(for example. If you have your own extend, skip it): // .vuepress/config module.exports = { extend: '@vuepress/theme-default', }; Copy Find this.$page.lastUpdated and format it. For example, if you extended @vuepress/theme-default, you could create .vuepress/theme/components/PageEdit.vue: <script> import format from 'date-fns/format'; import PageEdit from '@vuepress/theme-default/components/PageEdit'; export default { ...PageEdit, computed: { ...PageEdit.computed, lastUpdated() { return ( this.$page.lastUpdated && format(this.$page.lastUpdated, 'yyyy/MM/dd HH:mm:ss') ); }, }, }; </script> Copy

title: Installâ€‹
content: Mac: brew install fish Copy

title:
Set As Default Shell
optional
â€‹
content: Make sure where fish is: $ which fish /usr/local/bin/fish Copy Check if fish is a system shell now: cat /etc/shells Copy If there is no fish shell, add it into /etc/shells:  /bin/bash /bin/csh /bin/ksh /bin/sh /bin/tcsh /bin/zsh + /usr/local/bin/fish Copy You can set it as default shell: Set it as default shell: chsh -s /usr/local/bin/fish Copy

title: Fisherâ€‹
content: Fisher is a package manager for the fish shell. Install: curl https://git.io/fisher --create-dirs -sLo ~/.config/fish/functions/fisher.fish Copy If you can't use fisher command, try re-login the shell.

title: Spacefishâ€‹
content: Spacefish is a minimalistic, powerful and extremely customizable Fish Shell prompt. It combines everything you may need for convenient work, without unnecessary complications, like a real spacefish. fisher add matchai/spacefish Copy

title: Other commandsâ€‹
content: List packages: fisher ls fisher ls <regexp> fisher ls "^gitlab|fish-.*" Copy Update packages: fisher Copy Update fisher: fisher self-update Copy Remove package: fisher rm <packageName> fisher rm rafaelrinaldi/pure Copy Remove all packages: fisher ls | fisher rm Copy Uninstall fisher: fisher self-uninstall Copy

title: Fixing Perl Warning: Setting locale failed on Mac OSâ€‹
content: You might see this while you execute fisher: perl: warning: Setting locale failed. perl: warning: Please check that your locale settings: LC_ALL = (unset), LANG = "en_TW.UTF-8" are supported and installed on your system. Copy Edit fish config: vi ~/.config/fish/config.fish Copy Add locale environment variables: + export LC_CTYPE=en_US.UTF-8 + export LC_ALL=en_US.UTF-8 Copy Reference: Fixing Perl Warning: Setting locale failed on Mac OS X Mavericks

title: Integrate with nvmâ€‹
content: Node Version Manager - Simple bash script to manage multiple active node.js versions To install or update nvm, you can use the install script using cURL: curl -o- https://raw.githubusercontent.com/creationix/nvm/v0.34.0/install.sh | bash Copy or Wget: wget -qO- https://raw.githubusercontent.com/creationix/nvm/v0.34.0/install.sh | bash Copy Then install fish-nvm: fisher add FabioAntunes/fish-nvm edc/bass Copy If node is not loaded at start, create a init script: vi ~/.config/fish/conf.d/nvm.fish Copy and enter: nvm use node Copy If you always want to use the latest version, use the followed scripts instead: nvm install node # latest npm and yarn npm i -g npm yarn Copy then try another session.

title: Integrate with Dockerâ€‹
content: Migrate with docker(archived): fisher add barnybug/docker-fish-completion Copy Migrate with docker-compose: fisher add brgmnn/fish-docker-compose Copy

title: Integrate with Visual Studio Codeâ€‹
content: Edit settings.json: { "terminal.integrated.shell.osx": "/usr/local/bin/fish" } Copy

title: Integrate with Hyper.jsâ€‹
content: Edit ~/.hyper.js: module.exports = { shell: '/usr/local/bin/fish', }; Copy

title: Windows alternativeâ€‹
content: Cmder is a software package created out of pure frustration over the absence of nice console emulators on Windows. It is based on amazing software, and spiced up with the Monokai color scheme and a custom prompt layout, looking sexy from the start. ğŸ”—Seamless VS Code Integration ğŸ”—Seamless Hyper integration

title: Matchâ€‹
content: $ FOO=foo # use regular expression $ [[ $FOO =~ ^f ]] && echo matched || echo unmatched matched $ [[ $BAR =~ ^f ]] && echo matched || echo unmatched unmatched # use glob $ [[ $FOO == f* ]] && echo matched || echo unmatched matched $ [[ $BAR == f* ]] && echo matched || echo unmatched unmatched Copy Reference: https://stackoverflow.com/questions/17420994/how-can-i-match-a-string-with-a-regex-in-bash

title: Substringâ€‹
content: $ STRING=string # ${VARIABLE:START:LENGTH} $ echo ${STRING:3} ing $ echo ${STRING:2:4} ring Copy Reference: https://stackoverflow.com/questions/428109/extract-substring-in-bash

title: Ternary Operator
content: Ternary Operator In js: FOO === 'foo' ? (BAR = 'bar1') : (BAR = 'bar2'); Copy In bash: [[ $FOO = foo ]] && BAR=bar1 || BAR=bar2 Copy In js: FOO === 'foo1' ? (BAR = 'bar1') : (BAR = 'bar2'); Copy In bash: [[ $FOO = foo1 ]] && BAR=bar1 || BAR=bar2 Copy In js: BAR = FOO === 'foo1' ? 'bar1' : FOO === 'foo2' ? 'bar2' : 'bar3'; Copy In bash: BAR=$(echo $([[ $FOO = foo1 ]] && echo bar1 || ([[ $FOO = foo2 ]] && echo bar2 || echo bar3))) Copy Reference: https://stackoverflow.com/questions/3953645/ternary-operator-in-bash

title: Coding Styleâ€‹
content: Use Prettier as a formatter and use ESLint as an inspector(with eslint-config-prettier).

title: Date formatâ€‹
content: Use - for UTC time whereas use / for local time. console.log(new Date('2019-01-01')); /** * -> Tue Jan 01 2019 08:00:00 GMT+0800 (Taipei Standard Time) * UTC time */ console.log(new Date('2019/01/01')); /** * -> Tue Jan 01 2019 00:00:00 GMT+0800 (Taipei Standard Time) * local time */ Copy ğŸ”— reference: 3/14/2012 blog from danvk Comparing FF/IE/Chrome on Parsing Date Strings

title: monthIndexâ€‹
content: monthIndex is beginning with 0 for January to 11 for December. new Date(2019, 1, 1, 0, 0, 0, 0); // -> Fri Feb 01 2019 00:00:00 GMT+0800 (Taipei Standard Time) new Date(2019, 0, 1, 0, 0, 0, 0); // -> Tue Jan 01 2019 00:00:00 GMT+0800 (Taipei Standard Time) new Date('1989-02-13').getMonth(); // -> 1 Copy ğŸ”— reference: Date

title: Date Librariesâ€‹
content: date-fns(recommended)Moment.js

title: Equalityâ€‹
content: ğŸ”— reference: JavaScript-Equality-Table

title: Float Precisionâ€‹
content: Solutions: big.jsbignumber.jsdecimal.js big.js: minimalist; easy-to-use; precision specified in decimal places; precision applied to division only. bignumber.js: bases 2-64; configuration options; NaN; Infinity; precision specified in decimal places; precision applied to division only; base prefixes. decimal.js: bases 2-64; configuration options; NaN; Infinity; non-integer powers, exp, ln, log; precision specified in significant digits; precision always applied; random numbers. ğŸ”— reference: big.js vs. bignumber.js vs. decimal.js? #45 More info: Float Precision.

title: Interesting Encodesâ€‹
content: aaencodejjencodeJSFuck

title: NodeListâ€‹
content: NodeList is live. document.querySelectorAll() returns a static NodeList. { const parentDom = document.createElement('div'); const childClass = 'testChild'; const { childNodes } = parentDom; const appendChild = () => { const children = document.createElement('div'); children.classList.add(childClass); parentDom.appendChild(children); }; appendChild(); const querySelectorAll = parentDom.querySelectorAll(`.${childClass}`); const getElementsByClass = parentDom.getElementsByClassName(childClass); console.log(childNodes.length); // 1 console.log(getElementsByClass.length); // 1 console.log(querySelectorAll.length); // 1 appendChild(); console.log(childNodes.length); // 2 console.log(getElementsByClass.length); // 2 console.log(querySelectorAll.length); // 1 } Copy ğŸ”— reference: Nodeâ€‹List

title: Randomâ€‹
content: Math.random() does not provide cryptographically secure random numbers. Do not use them for anything related to security. Use the Web Crypto API instead, and more precisely the window.crypto.getRandomValues() method. API: getRandom(count: number): number[] getRandom({ count?: number, min?: number, max?: number, }): number[] /** * count: * browser: 1 ~ 2 ** 14 * node: 1 ~ Out Of Memory * min, max: 0 ~ 2 ** 32 - 1 */ Copy Inline: const getRandom = (() => { const maxMax = 2 ** 32 - 1; const getRandom = (options) => { let { count = 1, min = 0, max = maxMax } = typeof options === 'object' ? options : { count: options }; if (min < 0) throw new Error(`[getRandom] min is less than 0, min: ${min}`); if (max > maxMax) throw new Error(`[getRandom] max is greater than ${maxMax}, max: ${max}`); if (min > max) throw new Error( `[getRandom] min is greater than max, min: ${min}, max: ${max}` ); return Array.from( crypto.getRandomValues(new Uint32Array(count)), (v) => min + (v % (max - min + 1)) ); }; return getRandom; })(); Copy Module: import { inspect } from 'util'; const maxMax = 2 ** 32 - 1; const getRandom = (options) => { let { count = 1, min = 0, max = maxMax } = typeof options === 'object' ? options : { count: options }; if (min < 0) throw new Error(`[getRandom] min is less than 0, min: ${inspect(min)}`); if (max > maxMax) throw new Error( `[getRandom] max is greater than ${inspect(maxMax)}, max: ${inspect(max)}` ); if (min > max) throw new Error( `[getRandom] min is greater than max, min: ${inspect( min )}, max: ${inspect(max)}` ); return Array.from( crypto.getRandomValues(new Uint32Array(count)), (v) => min + (v % (max - min + 1)) ); }; export default getRandom; Copy Typescript: import { inspect } from 'util'; const maxMax: number = 2 ** 32 - 1; interface Options { count?: number; min?: number; max?: number; } const getRandom = (options?: number | Options): number[] => { let { count = 1, min = 0, max = maxMax } = typeof options === 'object' ? options : { count: options }; if (min < 0) throw new Error(`[getRandom] min is less than 0, min: ${inspect(min)}`); if (max > maxMax) throw new Error( `[getRandom] max is greater than ${inspect(maxMax)}, max: ${inspect(max)}` ); if (min > max) throw new Error( `[getRandom] min is greater than max, min: ${inspect( min )}, max: ${inspect(max)}` ); return Array.from( crypto.getRandomValues(new Uint32Array(count)), (v) => min + (v % (max - min + 1)) ); }; export default getRandom; Copy Node: const crypto = require('crypto'); const { inspect } = require('util'); const maxMax = 2 ** 32 - 1; const byte = 32 / 8; const getRandom = (options) => { let { count = 1, min = 0, max = maxMax } = typeof options === 'object' ? options : { count: options }; if (min < 0) throw new Error(`[getRandom] min is less than 0, min: ${inspect(min)}`); if (max > maxMax) throw new Error( `[getRandom] max is greater than ${inspect(maxMax)}, max: ${inspect(max)}` ); if (min > max) throw new Error( `[getRandom] min is greater than max, min: ${inspect( min )}, max: ${inspect(max)}` ); const random = crypto.randomBytes(count * byte); return Array.from( Array(count), (v, i) => min + (random.readUInt32BE(i * byte) % (max - min + 1)) ); }; module.exports = getRandom; Copy Node / multiple / async / thread: const crypto = require('crypto'); const { inspect } = require('util'); const maxMax = 2 ** 32 - 1; const getRandom = (options) => new Promise((resolve) => { let { count = 1, min = 0, max = maxMax } = typeof options === 'object' ? options : { count: options }; if (min < 0) throw new Error(`[getRandom] min is less than 0, min: ${inspect(min)}`); if (max > maxMax) throw new Error( `[getRandom] max is greater than ${inspect(maxMax)}, max: ${inspect( max )}` ); if (min > max) throw new Error( `[getRandom] min is greater than max, min: ${inspect( min )}, max: ${inspect(max)}` ); const a = new Uint32Array(count); crypto.randomFill(a, (err, buf) => { if (err) throw err; resolve(Array.from(buf, (v) => min + (v % (max - min + 1)))); }); }); module.exports = getRandom; Copy Reference: ğŸ”— crypto.randomBytes()ğŸ”— crypto.randomFill()ğŸ”— Cryptoâ€‹.getâ€‹Randomâ€‹Values()ğŸ”— Mathâ€‹.random()

title: RegExpâ€‹
content: More about regular expression

title: RegExp.prototypeâ€‹.test()â€‹
content: As with exec() (or in combination with it), test() called multiple times on the same global regular expression instance will advance past the previous match. var regex1 = RegExp('foo*'); var regex2 = RegExp('foo*', 'g'); var str1 = 'table football'; console.log(regex1.test(str1)); // expected output: true console.log(regex1.test(str1)); // expected output: true console.log(regex2.test(str1)); // expected output: true console.log(regex2.test(str1)); // expected output: false Copy ğŸ”— reference: RegExp.prototypeâ€‹.test()

title: SVGâ€‹
content: SVGR Transforms SVG into React Components.

title: Whitespace: encodeURIComponent vs URLSearchParamsâ€‹
content: encodeURIComponent / encodeURI encode whitespace into %20URLSearchParams encode whitespace into +. { console.log(new URLSearchParams('q=foo bar').toString()); // q=foo+bar console.log(encodeURI('q=foo bar')); // q=foo%20bar } Copy Server should decode both back to whitespace. Solution: qsquery-stringdecode-uri-component

title: Change Dock Size From Terminalâ€‹
content: defaults write com.apple.dock tilesize -int 32; killall Dock Copy reference: https://gist.github.com/oguzolmez/0e7120ec5de938e600b48b799b1d5c1d

title: Fix soundâ€‹
content: sudo killall coreaudiod Copy reference: https://www.makeuseof.com/tag/sound-advice-fixing-common-mac-audio-problems-os-x/

title: Fix Xcodeâ€‹
content: sudo rm -rf $(xcode-select -print-path) # Enter root password. No output is normal. xcode-select --install Copy reference: https://github.com/nodejs/node-gyp/issues/1927#issuecomment-546479900

title: Rearrange Launchpadâ€‹
content: rm ~/Library/Application\ Support/Dock/*.db; defaults write com.apple.dock ResetLaunchPad -bool true; killall Dock; Copy reference: https://apple.stackexchange.com/questions/280803/how-to-remove-blank-icon-from-launchpad-after-uninstall-app
